meanings.definition: To mess up or ruin something.
meanings.sent1: I bolloxed up the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: She always bolloxes her hair when she tries to style it herself.
meanings.sent3: The magician bolloxed his trick and made the rabbit disappear for good!
meanings.sent4: The storm bolloxed the garden, scattering leaves and branches everywhere.
meanings.sent5: His attempt to fix the computer only bolloxed it further, causing sparks to fly.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of confusion or disarray.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the living room was completely bolloxed with streamers and balloons.
meanings.sent2: The schedule got bolloxed up, and now no one knows when the meeting is.
meanings.sent3: The cat bolloxed the yarn into a tangled mess, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt bolloxed, unable to focus on anything with all the noise around.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam bolloxed the streets, causing chaos for commuters.
